items.title: Christmas lull or breakout ahead? BSE rejig, rupee among 8 factors to impact D-Street this week
items.description: Nifty snapped its four-session losing streak on Friday but still closed the week with a decline of 0.3%. Trading activity is expected to remain subdued across major global markets due to the extended Christmas holiday, even as Indian markets will be shut for just one day on Thursday, December 25.

items.title: World’s calmest stock market challenges options traders in India
items.description: India’s stock market has become one of the calmest in the world — so calm that it’s prompting a rethink of strategies among players in the country’s vast derivatives space.

items.title: These 11 penny stocks surged up to 55% in just a month. Do you own any?
items.description: Over the last month, 11 penny stocks delivered solid gains ranging from 15% to 55%, with two emerging as clear outperformers by surging more than 50%.These standout performers were identified through a focused screening strategy: each had a market capitalization under Rs 1,000 crore, a share price below Rs 20, and a minimum recent trading volume of 5 lakh shares. This method aims to spotlight low-priced, actively traded micro-cap stocks with strong price momentum. (Data Source: ACE Equity)Penny stocks often attract attention due to their low prices and potential for rapid growth. However, while the upside can be significant, so are the risks. These stocks typically have low liquidity, high price volatility, and limited financial transparency. As a result, successful investing in penny stocks requires more than just good luck—it demands a well-thought-out strategy and disciplined risk management.

items.title: Macro the Mightiest: ET Prime Special - Part 6: How the US ‘jobs report’ impacts markets, and why
items.description: Every month, the global financial engine pauses for a single data point: The US Employment Situation Summary. While ostensibly a headcount of workers, this “jobs report” has the power to shift billions in valuation within seconds in the US markets and, by extension, global markets. By deconstructing the Fed’s "dual mandate" on maximum employment and price stability we can uncover why investors treat these figures as a crystal ball for interest rates. Today, we will explore the connection between the US labour data and stock market volatility across the globe. In this series we discuss one macroeconomic factor every fortnight. Even a basic understanding will tell you when to react and when not to react to macroeconomic headlines.

items.title: The ripple effect: How consumer habits influence market moves
items.description: India’s growth story today is powered by its consumers. From bustling malls to the surge in e-commerce, the consumption sector is evolving against the backdrop of robust fundamentals.

items.title: Specialty chemicals: Is the worst over, or better to own the ecosystem? 19 stocks with upside potential ranging from
items.description: The chemicals sector (both specialty as well as commodity chemicals) is witnessing underlying changes at a reasonably strong pace that may soon bring it back into the limelight. These changes are focused on ensuring at least partial backward integration so that, over the medium term, dependence on Chinese imports comes down. This, however, will take time. At the same time, the chemicals sector has varied companies, each with a very different cycle. So, perhaps it's best to own a basket rather than just one or two stocks.

items.title: 10 Sensex stocks with up to 33% upside potential. Are these in your portfolio?
items.description: Analyst predictions often offer more than just numbers; they reveal where the next wave of market opportunity could emerge. For investors scanning the Sensex for potential outperformers, the latest analyst consensus highlights several heavyweight names that could deliver strong returns in the coming year.According to Trendlyne data, multiple Sensex stocks show promising upside potential over the next 12 months, based on average analyst target prices. This “upside” reflects the expected price gain from current levels, a research-backed indicator for investors looking to position ahead of potential rallies. Among these, 10 Sensex stocks stand out with projected gains of 18% to 33%, signaling solid return prospects in a market that’s becoming increasingly selective.

items.title: New investor additions in markets declined by 11.6% in November (MoM): NSE Report
items.description: The pace of new investor additions in the equity markets slowed in November, with growth declining 11.6 per cent month-on-month, as only 13.2 lakh new investors joined the market during the month, according to a report by the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

items.title: Top 10 biggest wealth creators: Which stocks made investors richest in 5 years? Check here
items.description: Indian equities delivered record wealth creation between 2020 and 2025, supported by a sharp post-pandemic recovery, Motilal Oswal said in its December 2025 Wealth Creation Study. The brokerage noted that the top 100 companies created Rs 148 trillion in wealth, growing at a 38% CAGR. Against this backdrop, these 10 stocks emerged as the biggest wealth creators over five years.

items.title: Top 10 fastest wealth creators: Which stocks made investors richest the fastest in 5 years? Check here
items.description: BSE emerged as the fastest wealth creator, delivering a 124% total return CAGR between 2020 and 2025, Motilal Oswal said. The stock topped the brokerage’s fastest wealth creators ranking.

items.title: Promoters cash out in 2025: Airtel, IndiGo among stocks that witnessed highest selling up to Rs 44,000 crore
items.description: Promoter selling surged to record levels in 2025, crossing Rs 1.5 lakh crore and surpassing last year’s peak of Rs 1.43 lakh crore. While the sharp rise has raised concerns among some investors, market veterans say the trend is more nuanced than the headline number suggests.

items.title: Can MUFG’s stake trigger re-rating for Shriram Finance? Here’s what experts are saying
items.description: Japan’s MUFG Bank has made a decisive statement on India’s lending sector with its plan to invest Rs 39,620 crore in Shriram Finance for a 20% equity stake, in what is poised to be the largest foreign direct investment in India’s financial services space.

items.title: Elon Musk’s $750 billion wealth eclipses India’s top four companies combined! What’s behind the rise?
items.description: Elon Musk’s net worth has soared to an eye-popping $749 billion—now larger than the combined market capitalisation of India’s four biggest listed companies: Reliance Industries ($236 billion), HDFC Bank ($184 billion), Bharti Airtel ($142 billion) and Tata Consultancy Services ($132 billion).

items.title: GMR Airports shares can rally 19% says JM Financial after initiating with Buy. 6 reasons why
items.description: Shares of GMR Airports, one of the world’s leading operators, can rally as much as 19% from current market levels, JM Financial said after initiating coverage on the counter, citing robust growth levers in the coming quarters.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Hindustan Copper and Shriram Finance on Monday for up to 6% upside. Here’s why
items.description: Nifty ended its four-day losing streak on Friday aided by strong buying action in auto, energy and financial stocks. The Nifty has witnessed a breakout from a falling wedge pattern, indicating improving market sentiment.Commenting on the current trends, Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities, said the index reclaimed the 21-day EMA on the daily chart. "After finding support near the 50-day EMA, the index recovered towards the 26,000 mark. Going forward, 26,000 will be a key level to watch; a decisive move above this level could propel the index towards 26,300. On the downside, immediate support is placed at 25,900, which is likely to act as the first line of defense for the Nifty," De said.Here are 2 stock recommendations for Monday:

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Monday
items.description: The Indian market ended higher on Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty a four-day losing run, as a cooler-than-expected U.S. inflation reading lifted global risk appetite and rekindled expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts in the year ahead.
